intro: Myrsine vaccinioides, commonly known as the dwarf myrsine, is a small evergreen shrub native to tropical and subtropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many other flowering plants. The plant features glossy, elliptical leaves that are typically dark green and arranged oppositely on the stems. It produces small, white, fragrant flowers that are clustered in umbels, followed by orange-red berries. Myrsine vaccinioides is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its compact size and attractive foliage.
